We must pass this budget, and give our military the adequate funding that they need to do their job.

From Iran and North Korea chasing nuclear weapons to China's build up in the South China Sea, we are facing threats from all corners of the world.  I am tired of reading about our brave men and women dying in training exercises.

The military is the backbone of our great nation and the blanket of security under which we rest.  I will always stand with our troops.  Always.  They have been let down, and the American people have been let down. Our leaders have to do better.
The fact that lawmakers would cast this aside in order to fulfill their own political narrative is baffling and shameful.

Their family and friends risk losing a loved one, but know the dignity of their decision. These brave young men and women are extraordinary, and their selflessness deserves our total reverence and respect.  Period.

When our service men and women volunteer to defend this country, they put their lives on the line each and every day for our freedom. They make the ultimate sacrifice, because they know the magnitude of their decision and the honor in their choice.

By reversing these damaging ‚Äúsequestration cuts‚Äù that have gutted our military and making necessary defense investments, we are beginning to repair a decade‚Äôs worth of damage.
Right now, we have ships that cannot go to sea, planes that cannot fly, and troops without the equipment they need to deploy.
It is wrong for us to send our best young men and women into harm's way without the resources they need, asking them to make up with their efforts, and their risk, for our shortcomings.
Congress has passed a budget deal to fully fund our military by reversing harmful ‚Äúsequestration cuts‚Äù and keep our government up and running.
